column5: That sure is a nice ride, it sure looks better than that old starcraft of mine we were talking about.
Nice boat Albert I have never owned a Ranger but all of my friends that do love them.  Art
Do you still have it?
yup, still got it but my buddy is supposed to pick it up in the spring, once my son takes the motor off it.
For the $'s looks like you did good Handyman,congrates!!!If you have any Q's about the resto feel free to shoot me a pm,I've done lots of boat tinkering:)
congrats nice boat!! .. now you need a cover
Nice ride dude! Welcome to the Ranger Club!!!
I do have a cover, it is 20' wide by 40' deep with a roll up door.

After a long and detailed search, (I now have a real good understanding of Craigslist   ), a bass boat has been found and hooked. This is a long awaited purchase, I researched and looked at countless ads for bass boats and others too, before making the choice to buy this one. I will need to do some work to it, carpet and seats. but the hull is quite sound. As well, there seems to be an issue with the shifting mechanisim, that I feel confident I can fix. (Thanks Boatman!) So here it is in all 17' 10" of wonderful lines.....
What'd I do wrong????
It looks like you used the direct link instead of the message board IMG code.
CLICK SHARE > GET LINK CODE (Tab at TOP) > IMAGE FOR BULLITEN BOARDS & FORUMS (grab the code under that)  Getting the 1st code gets you THIS...    2nd code gets you this (clickable version)
Hey Merry Christmas to you! Nice lookin' purchase and I see more fishin' in your future, both very good things.
Looks good 'Bert!... but you need to vacuum that volcanic ash out of it before it builds up much more.
Thanks all for the pic help!
nice ride..congrats!
Looks good...don't go adding any more seats...
Nice. What did you have to promise SWMBO to get that toy?  JF

Well, there is the house that we have fixed up, our children, my life insurance.....you get the picture Actually it was a planned purchase out of my inheritance. (I would rather have the man who taught me to love fishing and the family ties that come from it, but....)
Serious looking ride right there...    Congrats.......

Slick the way you subliminally slid the free advertising in there Albert. Congratulations on the new ride! I have seen you work wonders with construction adhesive and am sure you will have no problems with a bit of carpet. Jim
Very nice lookin boat & she should scoot right along with that 150
Congrats on your new ride Albert!
congrats hometown
Beauty rig hometown Congrats

I had the 350V Albert.  It had a 115 and did 54 mph with a 5 up stainless.You should get a few more hp,but your motor is much heavier then the 115 I had.  I would definitly look for a stainless porp for that motor.  Enjoy.
i believe i seen u towing ur new ride today around 11am at mud and centennial... heading east.
can i ask how much u saved buying it in the US and was it a hassle bringing it over? cheers!
Yes you did I was on my way back from my brothers, he was giving me advice on repairing the trailer fenders and ways to shine 'er up.

I did save bringing it over, but I did not have the ability to give it a good check out before pulling the trigger. Bringing it over was very easy, give US 72 hours notice, and show up at Canada customs, pay the duty and go. All in all about a half hour.
nice lookin rig! hope u get the repairs done ya need and she brings u lots of happy fish slimey days!
cool..thanks! I know you will get lots of enjoyment out of it....way to go..

Can't go wrong with a Ranger,,,SOLID rides  There will be a new re-designed '10 Ranger 621 on display at the Spring Fishing & Boat Show rigged with the new Yamaha Off-shore 300hp which has shed approx 250# for a total overall weight less than 565# !  Congrats on the new ride,,,,she's gonna serve ya well  Cheers G.
